de.johnnyjayjay.discord.api.command

Interface ICommand


  • public interface ICommand
    An interface used to describe a command. In order to use this API, every class which is supposed to execute commands must implement this interface.
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Johnny_JayJay

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canBeExecuted(net.dv8tion.jda.core.events.message.guild.GuildMessageReceivedEvent event)
      This method returns whether the command can be executed in the first place.
      net.dv8tion.jda.core.entities.MessageEmbed info(net.dv8tion.jda.core.entities.User user)
      This method is called if canBeExecuted() is false.
      void onCommand(net.dv8tion.jda.core.events.message.guild.GuildMessageReceivedEvent event, java.lang.String[] args)
      Everything that happens if the command is executed should be written here.

    • Method Detail

      • canBeExecuted

        boolean canBeExecuted(net.dv8tion.jda.core.events.message.guild.GuildMessageReceivedEvent event)
        This method returns whether the command can be executed in the first place. For instance, you can check on permissions by this. This is not supposed to distinguish between different arguments.
        Parameters:
        event - To decide whether your command will be executed, you get the event to work with.
        Returns:
        true: execute the command if it's called. false: do not execute it.

      • onCommand

        void onCommand(net.dv8tion.jda.core.events.message.guild.GuildMessageReceivedEvent event,
               java.lang.String[] args)
        Everything that happens if the command is executed should be written here. This is also the place for argument handling.
        Parameters:
        event - By this, you are given access to the event, in case you want to get its belongings or even modify it.
        args - Everything after the label. [prefix][label] [arg1] [arg2] ... [argN]

      • info

        net.dv8tion.jda.core.entities.MessageEmbed info(net.dv8tion.jda.core.entities.User user)
        This method is called if canBeExecuted() is false. Its purpose is to inform the user of the correct execution of the command or why he is not allowed to use it.
        Parameters:
        user - By this, you can mention the user or inform him about his permissions and roles.
        Returns:
        null, if you don't want to use it. Though if you want to, return a MessageEmbed with the information you'd like to provide.
